com.r2src.dyad
Class Dyad

java.lang.Object
  com.r2src.dyad.Dyad

public class Dyad
extends java.lang.Object

A Dyad is a pair of individuals maintaining a socially significant relationship. The prime purpose of a Dyad is to establish a peer-to-peer communication channel between these individuals, which can then be used to transfer any type of streaming data.

Dyads need to be bonded by calling #bond after setting a Bonder object with the #setBonder method. When a second device calls the bond method and its bonder supplies the same secret, the server will bond the devices and the Dyad is fully operational.

A fully operational Dyad can be used to request a DyadStream object by calling getStream(com.r2src.dyad.Foo, Handler).
